title: Senior Cloud Cyber Security Engineer - Lead
highlights: Improved vulnerability response and automation across hybrid cloud workloads.
Reduced ATO friction through reusable inheritance and control documentation.
Strengthened audit readiness for mission-critical USAF and Army applications.
bodyHtml:
Role Summary

Served as senior cybersecurity engineer for the Cloud One Common Computing Environment, supporting globally distributed hybrid cloud environments hosting critical DoD workloads.

Responsibilities

  • Led vulnerability triage and remediation planning across virtualized, containerized, and cloud-native systems.
  • Produced SAP, SAR, and POA&M artifacts supporting RMF and authorization workflows.
  • Implemented and validated controls aligned to NIST 800-53, SRGs, STIGs, and DoD 8500/8510 guidance.
  • Integrated security checks into CI/CD pipelines and advised system owners through RMF lifecycle sustainment.

Impact

Established repeatable security inheritance patterns and improved compliance velocity while sustaining operational security across IL4/IL5/IL6 systems.

title: Cloud Architect
highlights: Delivered USCENTCOM's first cloud-native IL5/IL6 deployments.
Created reusable IaC frameworks to reduce provisioning time and drift.
Established secure DevSecOps pipeline patterns across teams.
bodyHtml:
Role Summary

Led architecture for CENTCOM cloud modernization and initial Azure Government IL5/IL6 adoption, balancing mission delivery with strict security and compliance requirements.

Responsibilities

  • Designed secure enterprise cloud landing zones aligned to SRG, RMF, and SCCA requirements.
  • Architected DevSecOps workflows and standardized infrastructure templates.
  • Designed lakehouse analytics patterns with Azure Synapse and medallion architecture.
  • Produced technical trade studies and migration recommendations for mission owners.

Impact

Enabled CENTCOM's first scalable cloud architecture baseline with consistent governance, faster delivery, and improved mission analytics enablement.

company: SAIC - USCENTCOM J6 Technology Innovation Branch
title: Innovations Engineer, Cloud and Modernization
highlights: Influenced modernization decisions across HQ and theater operations.
Accelerated secure cloud adoption through governance-aligned engineering.
Improved interoperability planning for coalition and partner networks.
bodyHtml:
Role Summary

Advised CENTCOM J6 modernization initiatives by evaluating emerging technologies and mapping them to secure, interoperable adoption paths.

Responsibilities

  • Conducted technical evaluations of cyber, cloud, and network capabilities.
  • Authored briefs and analysis for senior leadership and mission planners.
  • Supported IL5/IL6 migration efforts and ATO-related engineering activities.
  • Coordinated architecture alignment across matrixed engineering teams.

Impact

Helped define a practical modernization roadmap that advanced cloud adoption while meeting security, interoperability, and mission constraints.

title: Senior Cyber Infrastructure Analyst
highlights: Strengthened defensive posture across HQ and theater environments.
Built an IL2 cyber test range for rapid engineering validation.
Improved uptime through Tier 2/3 troubleshooting and architecture tuning.
bodyHtml:
Role Summary

Designed and sustained cybersecurity boundary infrastructure for USCENTCOM headquarters and operational theater networks.

Responsibilities

  • Engineered and maintained firewalls, IDS/IPS, and filtering infrastructure.
  • Led planning for CND tool migration to JRSS and modernization tracks.
  • Built an automated cyber range in Azure Gov IL2 for experimentation.
  • Delivered leadership briefings on risk posture and modernization impacts.

Impact

Improved resilience, compliance, and testing velocity for cyber defense capabilities supporting mission operations.

company: CACI / L3 NSS - USAF Southwest Asia AOR
title: Network Operations SME, Senior
highlights: Sustained high availability across 17 bases supporting 10,000+ users.
Improved backbone performance and routing reliability.
Strengthened AAA and firewall resilience across the enterprise.
bodyHtml:
Role Summary

Led Tier 2/3 network operations and engineering for USAF infrastructure serving multiple bases in Southwest Asia.

Responsibilities

  • Supported WAN, VoIP, routing, switching, and data center platforms.
  • Designed and maintained BGP/OSPF/EIGRP/MPLS topologies.
  • Managed ACS, AD integrations, and enterprise firewall clusters.
  • Implemented cybersecurity hardening on network and Windows infrastructure.

Impact

Maintained mission-critical availability and improved security posture across large-scale distributed network operations.

title: Network Operations Technician
highlights: Reduced downtime with rapid routing and firewall issue resolution.
Improved AD and DNS service reliability across supported bases.
Enforced secure baseline configurations for enterprise systems.
bodyHtml:
Role Summary

Delivered Tier 0-2 operational support for core network, identity, and security services in USAF enterprise environments.

Responsibilities

  • Troubleshot WAN, DNS, routing, and firewall incidents.
  • Applied DoD-approved router/switch configurations.
  • Supported AD/GPO operations and Windows hardening standards.
  • Provided remote support to comm squadrons across installations.

Impact

Improved service reliability and baseline security for critical network operations supporting NIPR and SIPR environments.

company: United States Marine Corps, 3rd Marine Division
title: 0651 Data Network Specialist
highlights: Supported classified/unclassified operations for 3,000+ users.
Improved readiness through reliable SIPR/NIPR network support.
Strengthened INFOSEC and OPSEC compliance practices.
bodyHtml:
Role Summary

Provided network and systems support for mission-critical military communications across classified and unclassified environments.

Responsibilities

  • Delivered remote and on-site support for Windows and UNIX users.
  • Maintained SIPR/NIPR communications and user services.
  • Managed accounts, permissions, and workstation support.
  • Supported field exercises and deployments with communications operations.

Impact

Contributed to stable communications posture and operational readiness in high-demand military environments.
